meanings.definition: To treat someone unfairly or harshly.
meanings.sent1: He was dicking his friend by not sharing the toys.
meanings.sent2: The boss was dicking the employees by making them work overtime without pay.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was dicking the students by giving pop quizzes every day.
meanings.sent4: The referee was dicking the visiting team with biased calls.
meanings.sent5: The bully was dicking the younger kids by taking their lunch money every day.

meanings.definition: To engage in sexual activity with someone.
meanings.sent1: They were dicking in the bedroom all night.
meanings.sent2: The couple was dicking in the park, unaware of the onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The movie characters were dicking in every scene, making it awkward to watch.
meanings.sent4: The teenagers were dicking behind the school, thinking they were being sneaky.
meanings.sent5: The animals were dicking in the zoo, much to the amusement of the visitors.

meanings.definition: To waste time or fool around.
meanings.sent1: Stop dicking around and finish your homework.
meanings.sent2: They were dicking around instead of studying for the test.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were dicking around in the backyard, playing tag.
meanings.sent4: The friends were dicking around at the mall, trying on silly hats.
meanings.sent5: The employees were dicking around at work, pretending to be busy.

meanings.definition: A slang term for the male genitalia.
meanings.sent1: He got hit in the dicking during the soccer game.
meanings.sent2: The comedian made a joke about the dicking in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled when they heard the word dicking in class.
meanings.sent4: The doctor asked the patient if he had any issues with his dicking.
meanings.sent5: The artist drew a funny cartoon character with a big dicking.
